inclusion.criterion: between 8-18 years of age, and have been in remission for at least 4 weeks as indicated by a PCDAI <10.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: assigned without bias to a dose group
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: one-hour fasting blood sample and a spot urine collection will be collected, a PCDAI will be administered, and patients will complete a food frequency questionnaire (FFQ) that will include information on Vitamin D and calcium supplement use (including dose and duration) as well as a lifestyle and demographic questionnaire.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Treatment Visit: One-hour fasting blood and spot urine will be collected and the PCDAI will be administered at baseline, 3 months (+/- 1 week), and 6 months (+/- 1 week) after baseline.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: 25OHD concentrations are thought to stabilize after 8 weeks of supplementation at a constant dose.
inclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: taking corticosteroids, or taking more than 400 IU Vitamin D at enrollment
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: occurrence of adverse events that are judged to be severe enough for discontinuation.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: The patient has a confirmed diagnosis of Paget's Disease of Bone and is starting Bisphosphonate therapy.
